page.title: 20THE FUTURE OF SANDHURST
page.content: CAUSE FOR CONCERN Sandhurst residents are concerned that their village is growing, but only as a dormitory suburb of Gloucester. The growth has not brought extra services to the village. The newcomers have cars of their own and do not rely on public transport or local shops. They work outside Sandhurst and their families are too old to use the village school. Young people have to leave the village to find work, they cannot afford to return to the expensive new houses. The older residents fear that more cars will mean demands for widening the narrow lanes to the village and a loss of hedgerows. The closure of the school and merging of parishes will lead to a loss of village identity. Sadly, the future does not look bright for Sandhurst, soon the village will have changed its character completely.
